titleStmt.title: A dose for Chamberlain, and a pill for the doctor; being an answer to two scurrilous pamphlets, written against the author of the Asses complaint, &c.
titleStmt.author: Cook, William, fl. 1661.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription B02373 of text R220207 in the English Short Title Catalog (Wing C6040). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal . The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

titleStmt.title: A dose for Chamberlain, and a pill for the doctor; being an answer to two scurrilous pamphlets, written against the author of the Asses complaint, &c.
titleStmt.author: Cook, William, fl. 1661.

notesStmt.note: Verse: "VVhat ailes this bauling puppy thus to prate? ..."
In answer to Robert Chamberlain's Balaam's asse cudgeld; and Edmund Cooper's The asse beaten for bawling.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
